results.title: Hear her calling you (preview for an interactive work)
results.creator_credit: Advanced Diploma of Multimedia (ADoM), Swinburne University of Technology (formerly Electronic Design and Interactive Media (EDIM) and Brett Mahon
results.brief_description: As part of the end of year screening for the Swinburne, EDIM (Electronic Design and Interactive Media) course - those students who had completed interactive coursework were required to create a linear representation of their work for the showreel. Tis student should be contacted and asked to submit to the Interactive collection

results.title: Hear better: healthy ears
results.brief_description: Opens with a summary of the pleasures that result from hearing well. The structure of the ear is shown in detail and the process of receiving air vibrations and transmitting them into sounds is explained. Concludes with general information on how to take care of the ears.
results.description: Opens with a summary of the pleasures that result from hearing well. The structure of the ear is shown in detail and the process of receiving air vibrations and transmitting them into sounds is explained. Concludes with general information on how to take care of the ears.

results.title: Healthy mother, healthy baby
results.brief_description: In this program the importance of proper nutrition and good eating habits during pregnancy are stressed. Also, the need for expectant mothers to make sound decisions regarding the use of alcohol, cigarettes, caffeine, and drugs, are explained. This film offers a valuable guide to pregnant women and teenagers.

results.title: Healthy lungs
results.creator_credit: David A. Smart and Coronet Instructional Films
results.brief_description: Shows the part of the breathing mechanism in contact with the air and demonstrates how the exchange of waste products for oxygen takes place. Explains how disease affects the lungs and recommends procedures to keep the lungs in a healthy condition.

results.title: Health: the inside story
results.brief_description: A common-sense approach to attaining and maintaining good health. Shows the role of muscular endurance, heart and lung endurance and nutrition in a healthy lifestyle. Indicates health hazards such as smoking and stress, and emphasises the need for relaxation. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Health: personal cleanliness. - Second edition.
results.brief_description: In a positive, friendly manner, instructs youngsters who need help forming good hygiene habits and reinforces the attitudes of those whose good habits are already formed. Particular attention is given to cleaning the skin, hair, fingernails, and teeth, and explains why it is necessary.

results.title: Health: communicable diseases. - 2nd edition.
results.creator_credit: David Winter, Michael Wright and AIMS Instructional Media
results.brief_description: Using an animated clay germ to answer the question of how people get sick. The germ tells where germs live and how they are spread from person to person, and then shows how they can be prevented from spreading. Also presents cautionary measures to be taken when sick, along with cautions about taking medicine without grown-up supervision.

results.title: Health service in Britain
results.creator_credit: Frank Gardner and Central Office of Information
results.brief_description: A survey of medical treatment available under Britain’s National Health Scheme. Some of the medical attention which can be obtained on the advice of the general practitioner. Includes specialised services in pre-natal and post-natal care; ophthalmic, dental and orthopaedic treatment; chest clinics; mental health; geriatrics and rehabilitation centres.

results.title: Health of a nation
results.brief_description: A survey of the measures carred out by the British Government to safeguard the people’s health: pre-natal clinics, maternity hospitals, child welfare centres, and school medical services help to ensure that the rising generation is healthy, but the importance of environment is not overlooked. Slums are being replaced by modern housing estates, and special measures are taken to combat industrial diseases which cause ill-health among industrial workers.
